p: The production cost is composed by two main components: operating and capital costs. Operating costs are associated with the annual expenses with feedstock, maintenance, labor, chemical substances, among other inputs; whereas the capital cost is calculated based on the annual payment that would be necessary to remunerate the total investment at an assumed 12% per year interest rate over a 25-year period. This amount of money represents the opportunity cost of the investment associated with the decision of building a new plant.
